parameters.name: Propagate
parameters.description: True propagates the sweep cut to the next edge, false causes the sweep cut to occur only on the selected edge; to propagate to the next edge, the next edge must be tangent to the current edge

parameters.name: Alignment
parameters.description: If the curve used to sweep goes from one face to another or from one edge to another, then true causes the sweep to cut completely through the end faces of the cut, and false causes the cut to begin and end perpendicular to the sweep curve; therefore, it may not break through the two end faces of the body being cut

parameters.name: TwistCtrlOption
parameters.description: Twist control options as defined in swTwistControlType_e

parameters.name: KeepTangency
parameters.description: If the sweep section has tangent segments, true causes the corresponding surfaces in the resulting sweep to be tangent, false does not

parameters.name: BAdvancedSmoothing
parameters.description: If the sweep section has circular or elliptical arcs, true approximates the sections and smooths the surfaces, false does not

parameters.name: StartMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as defined in swTangencyType_e

parameters.name: EndMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as defined in swTangencyType_e

parameters.name: IsThinBody
parameters.description: True if this feature is a thin body, false if not

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Thickness value for the first direction

parameters.name: Thickness2
parameters.description: Thickness value for the second direction

parameters.name: ThinType
parameters.description: Thin wall type as defined in swThinWallType_e

parameters.name: PathAlign
parameters.description: Align path type (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

parameters.name: TwistAngle
parameters.description: If TwistCtrlOption is set to swTwistControlType_e.swTwistControlConstantTwistAlongPath, then specify end twist angle

parameters.name: BMergeSmoothFaces
parameters.description: True to merge smooth faces, false to not

parameters.name: AssemblyFeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the sweep cut affects only selected components in the assembly, false if the sweep cut affects all components in the assembly ( see Remarks )

parameters.name: AutoSelectComponents
parameters.description: True to auto-select all affected components in the assembly, false to use manually selected components ( see Remarks )

parameters.name: PropagateFeatureToParts
parameters.description: True to extend the sweep cut feature to all affected parts in the assembly, false to just insert the sweep cut into the assembly ( see Remarks )

parameters.name: Propagate
parameters.description: True propagates the sweep cut to the next edge, false causes the sweep cut to occur only on the selected edge; to propagate to the next edge, the next edge must be tangent to the current edge

parameters.name: Alignment
parameters.description: If the curve used to sweep goes from one face to another or from one edge to another, then true causes the sweep to cut completely through the end faces of the cut, and false causes the cut to begin and end perpendicular to the sweep curve; therefore, it may not break through the two end faces of the body being cut

parameters.name: TwistCtrlOption
parameters.description: Twist control options as defined in swTwistControlType_e

parameters.name: KeepTangency
parameters.description: If the sweep section has tangent segments, true causes the corresponding surfaces in the resulting sweep to be tangent, false does not

parameters.name: BAdvancedSmoothing

parameters.name: Thickness1

parameters.name: ThinType

parameters.name: PathAlign
parameters.description: Align path type (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

parameters.name: TwistAngle
parameters.description: If TwistCtrlOption is set to swTwistControlType_e.swTwistControlConstantTwistAlongPath, then specify end twist angle

parameters.name: BMergeSmoothFaces

parameters.name: AssemblyFeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the sweep cut affects only selected components in the assembly, false if the sweep cut affects all components in the assembly ( see Remarks )

parameters.name: AutoSelectComponents
parameters.description: True to auto-select all affected components in the assembly, false to use manually selected components ( see Remarks )

parameters.name: PropagateFeatureToParts
parameters.description: True to extend the sweep cut feature to all affected parts in the assembly, false to just insert the sweep cut into the assembly ( see Remarks )

remarks:
Before calling this method, call
IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2
multiple times to select the profile, guide curves, and sweep path for the cut, setting the Mark parameter in each case as follows:
1 = Profile selection
2 = Guide-curve selection, if provided
4 = Sweep path selection
The PathAlign argument is available when TwistCtrlOption is set to 0 and can take one of these values:
0 = None; no correction (default)
2 = Direction vector; a plane, planar face, or line defines the path
3 = All faces; includes neighboring faces
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
When using cut or cavity features that result in multiple bodies, you cannot select to keep all of the resulting bodies or one or more selected bodies.
Use AssemblyFeatureScope, AutoSelectComponents, and PropagateFeatureToParts to insert sweep cuts into an assembly. AssemblyFeatureScope and AutoSelectComponents perform just like the configuration of the Feature Scope section on the PropertyManager page of the sweep feature:
AssemblyFeatureScope setting
AutoSelectComponents setting
PropertyManager page Feature Scope setting
False
Ignored
All components selected
Auto-select not visible
True
If true, affected components are automatically selected
If false, manually select the affected components in the view before calling this API
Selected components selected
If Auto-select is not seelcted, then manually select affected components in the view
